issue.title: Close special workspace after moving windows out of it
issue.body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
Fix the issue that currently when you use `movetoworkspace` to move a window out of the special workspace into a regular WS, it doesn't close the special WS. This also causes weird behavior like being able to move windows in regular workspaces around when in the special WS. 
Seems to me that the correct behavior should be getting out of the special workspace and showing the regular workspace. If I wanted to stay in the current special WS, I would use `movetoworkspacesilent` instead.

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
No

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?
Ready

comment.body: I still don't know what this is fixing. Can I get a reproducible (on head) bug that this will fix?

issue.title: new `Misc option` 'new_window_takes_over_fullscreen = 2'  works abnormally
issue.body:
### Hyprland Version

Hyprland, built from branch main at commit 386708563c3d9d85ffd60b4eeb6c767d29f948db dirty (workspacerules: search for special properly). Tag: v0.31.0-12-g38670856  flags: (if any) debug

### Bug or Regression?

Bug

### Description

The menu window of many applications is treated as a normal window, causing the current full-screen application window to exit  fullscreen state(like vscode,smplayer,fcitx4)


https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/30348075/a76ccdd6-bd22-414c-ae81-f9fb7498fc45



### How to reproduce

1.set misc option
```
misc {
    new_window_takes_over_fullscreen = 2
}
```
2.open vscode and  fullscreen it

3.open right button menu

### Crash reports, logs, images, videos

_No response_

commits.message:
events: ignore takes_over_fullscreen for floating windows

fixes #3622. Floating windows should not respect the config option, they should be shown on top. That option is meant for tiled only

issue.title: Hypland Crash on launch
issue.body:
### Hyprland Version

AUR hyprland-nvidia-git (0.31.0.r29.g616ff343-1)

### Bug or Regression?

Bug

### Description

Hi, I currently am running Hyprland on Arch Linux and use the display manager ly. A few days ago I was running Hyprland fine until my laptop had died and now I cannot access Hyprland. 

My laptop is a HP Victus with an i5-12450h cpu with integrated graphics and an Nvidia GTX 1650 Mobile. I am running Hypland-nvidia under hybrid mode (I was never able to confirm whether or not the gpu was being used) and suspect that that is the case for this crash. Furthermore, even before the crash began, I have never been able to suspend/close the laptop lid without Hypland or Wayland crashing.  

Listed below is the crash dump as displayed by the Crashed Processes Viewer. I will post more info if necessary.

### How to reproduce

Launch Hyprland in ly

### Crash reports, logs, images, videos

           PID: 829 (Hyprland)
           UID: 1000 (b00xter)
           GID: 1000 (b00xter)
        Signal: 6 (ABRT)
     Timestamp: Tue 2023-10-24 21:02:37 CDT (15s ago)
    Command Line: Hyprland
    Executable: /usr/bin/Hyprland
    Control Group: /user.slice/user-1000.slice/session-2.scope
          Unit: session-2.scope
         Slice: user-1000.slice
       Session: 2
     Owner UID: 1000 (b00xter)
       Boot ID: 8e89e1afe9c94d9dbac0e63fe8be92b2
    Machine ID: c562a2276ba74478a59fc2014d4760c1
      Hostname: a4chb0x
       Storage: 
     /var/lib/systemd/coredump/core.Hyprland.1000.8e89e1afe9c94d9dbac0e63fe8be92b2.829.1698199357000000.zst (present)
      Size on Disk: 1.5M
         Message: Process 829 (Hyprland) of user 1000 dumped core.
                
                Stack trace of thread 829:
                #0  0x00007f9c51d9a83c n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x8e83c)
                #1  0x00007f9c51d4a668 raise (libc.so.6 + 0x3e668)
                #2  0x00007f9c51d324b8 abort (libc.so.6 + 0x264b8)
                #3  0x000055eb5f59877a _Z25handleUnrecoverableSignali (Hyprland + 0xc177a)
                #4  0x00007f9c51d4a710 n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x3e710)
                #5  0x00007f9c526bb664 wlr_backend_get_drm_fd (libwlroots.so.12032 + 0x4e664)
                #6  0x00007f9c526a4e32 n/a (libwlroots.so.12032 + 0x37e32)
                #7  0x00007f9c526c3f3c n/a (libwlroots.so.12032 + 0x56f3c)
                #8  0x00007f9c526be4d2 wlr_drm_backend_create (libwlroots.so.12032 + 0x514d2)
                #9  0x00007f9c526bb435 n/a (libwlroots.so.12032 + 0x4e435)
                #10 0x00007f9c526bbbae wlr_backend_autocreate (libwlroots.so.12032 + 0x4ebae)
                #11 0x000055eb5f5ae190 _ZN11CCompositor10initServerEv (Hyprland + 0xd7190)
                #12 0x000055eb5f584205 main (Hyprland + 0xad205)
                #13 0x00007f9c51d33cd0 n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x27cd0)
                #14 0x00007f9c51d33d8a __libc_start_main (libc.so.6 + 0x27d8a)
                #15 0x000055eb5f5985f5 _start (Hyprland + 0xc15f5)
                
                Stack trace of thread 843:
                #0  0x00007f9c51d954ae n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x894ae)
                #1  0x00007f9c51d97d40 pthread_cond_wait (libc.so.6 + 0x8bd40)
                #2  0x00007f9c520d9e11 __gthread_cond_wait (libstdc++.so.6 + 0xd9e11)
                #3  0x000055eb5f6936b6 n/a (Hyprland + 0x1bc6b6)
                #4  0x00007f9c520e1943 execute_native_thread_routine (libstdc++.so.6 + 0xe1943)
                #5  0x00007f9c51d989eb n/a (libc.so.6 + 0x8c9eb)

                ELF object binary architecture: AMD x86-64

issue.title: Add a timestamp of the last window activation to `hyprctl clients`
issue.body:
### Description

I have a small program that allows me to quickly switch to different windows by typing their name kinda like [this](https://github.com/kvakulo/Switcheroo) and I would really like to sort the windows by their last activation time so that if I type a part of the name and just press enter I would be taken to the most recently activated window containing what I've typed.

issue.title: Toggleopaque for several window
issue.body:
### Description

Hey, I searched for a while but didn't find anything to make this command on several (or all in my case) window at the same times. The only thing I found was to set a window rule with `hyprctl keyword windowrulev2 'opaque,class:(.)'` but only the new windows respect this rule and the active one. The other doesn't seems to detect the change.
Another technique I found was to source a file with this only rules, but the result is the same.

I'm trying to make a shortcut that disable animations, blur and set opacity to 1 but I can't without setting the opacity.
Thank you for reading me

comment.body: hyprctl reload will clear any dynamic vars and replace them with config'd ones.

issue.title: Tablet Issue with fractional scaling and xwayland apps (force_zero_scaling=true)
issue.body:
### Hyprland Version

Hyprland, built from branch  at commit 1b48642fd15c433c53876f1b933dcd46265caf8f dirty (). Tag: v0.30.0

### Bug or Regression?

Bug

### Description

Hi all, 

I was trying a wacom intuos medium tablet on Hyprland (specifically with Aseprite and Krita, two apps that can only run with xwayland). On my display I have fractional scaling with 1.5, and on xwayland I enabled the force_zero_scaling setting. My problem is that the tablet can only reach 2/3 of the screen in those apps. If I set the 1.5 setting back to zero, this problem disappears. 

Couldn't find someone else with similar problems, so I figure this is the best place to ask. Not sure if this is the issue with Hyprland or issues with xwayland apps. 

Thanks!

Related Configs:
```
monitor=HDMI-A-1, 2560x1440,1920x0,1.5
monitor=eDP-1, preferred, auto, 1.75

xwayland {
	force_zero_scaling = true
}

...

device:wacom-intuos-bt-m-pen { 
	transform=2560x1440
	output=HDMI-A-1
}
```

### How to reproduce

1. Set scaling to be 1.5 on monitor
2. Set force_zero_scaling=true for xwayland
3. Use tablet in Krita

### Crash reports, logs, images, videos

_No response_

forkee.name: Hyprland
forkee.description: Hyprland is a highly customizable dynamic tiling Wayland compositor that doesn't sacrifice on its looks.

comment.body: I guess we can now close this issue. I should have linked it to the PR. My bad.

issue.title: Blur shader new customization options
issue.body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
This PR adds new and changes existing customization options for `decoration.blur`.

The new `blur` settings are:
```bash
    # Clamp the brightness after the blurring
    # Allows for a more precise intuitive control than `brightness`
    min_brightness = 0.0
    max_brightness = 1.0    

    # The new color boosting
    boost_colors = true
    saturation_boost = 0.1    
    brightness_boost = 0.0 
    
    base_brightness = 1 # Like previous brightness
```

Other changes:
- Replaced `brightness` with `base_brightness`
- `contrast` and `base_brightness` now get applied only before the blur.


#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
The clamping part ( `softClamp` ) in `Textures.hpp` is currently not optimized.
It should be possible to rewrite it without if statement, but right now it is nice and readable.
I dont know if removing the ifs would increase performance.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?
~~I could not find where the default config gets generated and add the new setting there.
This still needs to get implemented.~~
Yes. It could be more optimized, but for now its better than before and the code is clean.

comment.body:
> Awesome, thank you, Ill update test it and update the PR later :)
> 
> 
> 
> And your `float(bool == bool)` does not seem like branching as its just a multiplication.
> 
> Im not very knowledgeable with shaders yet though :D 

I've also heard multiple times that certain functions like ’step’ actually get compiled to branches (don't know if that's true) and that branches nowadays aren't *as* costly as they originally were...

In any case, I made it a little less branching lol.

commits.message:
input: fix force_zero_scaling for tablet and touch (#3644)

* Attempt to fix force_zero_scaling for tablet and touch for XWayland apps.

* Formated using clang-format.

* Simpler way to compute touch origin.

pull_request.title: Attempt to fix force_zero_scaling for tablet and touch
pull_request.body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?

Tries to fix tablet and touch events not scaled back (mouse is OK) when using `force_zero_scaling` on XWayland windows and output scale is not 1. (Fixing #3573 ) 

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)

My knowledge of the code base and event propagation mechanisms of Hyprland is really limited. I hope I haven't forgotten anything.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?

It needs to be thoroughly tested. I'm currently using it with Krita (which doesn't support Wayland) and I've done some tests with xev to check that mouse, tablet and touch positions match.

issue.title: Handle _NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS
issue.body:
### Description

VMWare's multi-monitor support relies on _NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS, which is not supported by Hyprland. Currently, it throws an error when toggling multi-monitor:
> This virtual machine cannot use multiple monitors for the following reasons:
> \* The current host window manager does not support multiple monitors.

Discussions from i3wm: https://github.com/i3/i3/issues/2116

comment.body: this won't work well due to some issues with how xwayland works in hyprland. Why doesnt VMWare just open two separate windows?

issue.body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
This PR adds new and changes existing customization options for `decoration.blur`.

The new `blur` settings are:
```bash
    # Clamp the brightness after the blurring
    # Allows for a more precise intuitive control than `brightness`
    min_brightness = 0.0
    max_brightness = 1.0    

    # The new color boosting
    boost_colors = true

comment.body: Done. The last commit contains your patch.
Again, x11 "units" was just a way to express the fact there are, in mathematical terms, two coordinate spaces with different metrics. Sorry for being unclear.

comment.body:
Well, I did not mean scale them, I mean doing a computation to output the correct event value. 

Ok, simpler way to compute origin.

pull_request.title: Attempt to fix force_zero_scaling for tablet and touch
pull_request.body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?

Tries to fix tablet and touch events not scaled back (mouse is OK) when using `force_zero_scaling` on XWayland windows and output scale is not 1. (Fixing #3573 ) 

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)

My knowledge of the code base and event propagation mechanisms of Hyprland is really limited. I hope I haven't forgotten anything.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?

It needs to be thoroughly tested. I'm currently using it with Krita (which doesn't support Wayland) and I've done some tests with xev to check that mouse, tablet and touch positions match.

issue.title: Handle _NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS
issue.body:
### Description

VMWare's multi-monitor support relies on _NET_WM_FULLSCREEN_MONITORS, which is not supported by Hyprland. Currently, it throws an error when toggling multi-monitor:
> This virtual machine cannot use multiple monitors for the following reasons:
> \* The current host window manager does not support multiple monitors.

Discussions from i3wm: https://github.com/i3/i3/issues/2116

issue.title: Flicking Camera Position In Game(s)
issue.body:
### Hyprland Version

Hyprland, built from branch HEAD at commit 5b8cfdf2efc44106b61e60c642fd964823fd89f3  (props: bump ver to v0.31.0).

### Bug or Regression?

Bug

### Description

World of Warcraft, run through Proton via Steam, the camera direction will sometimes 'flick' upwards and cause my character to start running the opposite way if I hold right click (which changes camera and character direction alongside it). Apparently fixed in Sway?
Gamescope glitches the game out causing disconnects and auto walk to stop working when in a different workspace (single monitor setup), not an ideal solution. Worse experience than the occasional camera flick.

### How to reproduce

Play a game, make camera direction tied to cursor position. Occasionally will flick the position away at seemingly random.

### Crash reports, logs, images, videos

_No response_

comment.body:
> "reportedly fixed" by what commit/pr?

Apologies it may be just false info fed to me by a redditor (reddit moment). Misinformation spreads so easily!
I will be doing my own testing to see if SDL_VIDEODRIVER=x11 helps resolve the occasional and random camera flick. 

It is likely a similar Wayland issue causing the problem in FFXIV, but Gamescope causes more problems than it solves for me to the game when I do not have it in focus.

issue.title: Hyprland ends up in red screen after constantly trying to enable MSI monitor when DPMS is off
issue.body:
[hyprland.log](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/13183362/hyprland.log)
### Hyprland Version

v0.30.0

### Bug or Regression?

Bug

### Description

When DPMS is off on my MSI MAG274QRF-QD, hyprland keeps doing the following logs:

```
okt 26 23:40:11 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:33.227 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:746] connector DP-2: Turning off
okt 26 23:40:11 NixOS-justin swayidle[560913]: ok
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:44.498 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:1494] Scanning DRM connectors on /dev/dri/card0
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:44.565 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:1578] 'DP-2' disconnected
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:44.565 [ERROR] [types/output/swapchain.c:109] Swapchain for output 'DP-2' failed test
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:44.565 [ERROR] [types/output/swapchain.c:109] Swapchain for output 'DP-2' failed test
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:44.566 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:746] connector DP-2: Turning off
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin swayidle[363256]: 2023-10-26 23:40:23 - [main.c:244] Destroy surface for output (null)
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:44.566 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:1494] Scanning DRM connectors on /dev/dri/card0
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338542]: 2023-10-26 23:40:23 - [main.c:397] Destroying output DP-2 (Microstep MAG274QRF-QD CA8A270B00307)
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin .waybar-wrapped[561168]: static void Glib::DispatchNotifier::unreference_instance(Glib::DispatchNotifier*, const Glib::Dispatcher*): assertion 'instance == notifier' failed
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin waybar[338992]: [2023-10-26 23:40:23.250] [info] Bar removed from output: DP-2
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:45.040 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:1494] Scanning DRM connectors on /dev/dri/card0
okt 26 23:40:23 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:43:45.316 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:1570] 'DP-2' connected
```

It keeps doing this until the kernel decides to kill swayidle, because it runs out of memory. After which this is printed:

```
okt 26 23:47:25 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:50:46.970 [INFO] [libseat] [libseat/backend/logind.c:382] Disabling seat
okt 26 23:47:25 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[338372]: 00:50:46.970 [INFO] [backend/drm/backend.c:143] DRM fd paused
```

At this point my screen turns red as soon as I unlock swaylock, and the only way to recover is to kill hyprland from another tty and then login again through gdm3.

### How to reproduce

Use swaylock/swayidle with a MSI monitor

Hyprland config is here:
https://github.com/Arroquw/nixos-config/tree/main/home/desktop/hyprland

Swaylock/swayidle configs:
https://github.com/Arroquw/nixos-config/tree/main/home/default.nix
https://github.com/Arroquw/nixos-config/tree/main/home/pc-i9_9900k-rtx3090/default.nix

### Crash reports, logs, images, videos

journalctl gives a constant output of the following:

```
okt 27 00:13:16 NixOS-justin /nix/store/rl9qqy5n41is2dvmnplbfvlaj5dsda44-gdm-44.1/libexec/gdm-wayland-session[4841]: 00:19:28.059 [INFO] [backend/drm/drm.c:746] connector DP-2: Turning off

Until it happened too often, making it crash:
```
okt 26 23:47:20 NixOS-justin kernel: oom-kill:constraint=CONSTRAINT_NONE,nodemask=(null),cpuset=/,mems_allowed=0,global_oom,task_memcg=/user.slice/user-1000.slice/user@1000.service/app.slice/swayidle.service,task=swaylock,pid=363256,uid=1000
okt 26 23:47:20 NixOS-justin kernel: Out of memory: Killed process 363256 (swaylock) total-vm:10629628kB, anon-rss:6387984kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:57984kB, UID:1000 pgtables:12724kB oom_score_adj:200
```

No crash reports are generated by hyprland
